title: Cecile Richards Leaves Behind Brutal Legacy As She Steps Down From Planned Parenthood
text:
Total:
Cecile Richards Leaves Behind Brutal Legacy As She Steps Down From Planned Parenthood
Wednesday, January 24, 2018 15:34
% of readers think this story is Fact. Add your two cents.
Cecile Richards leaves behind a brutal legacy as she departs from her position as the president of Planned Parenthood.
Richards — who  reportedly told  the organization’s board Wednesday that she planned to step down — pioneered a company that has aborted 7,132,130 babies since Margaret Sanger’s founding of the abortion organization. Planned Parenthood  aborted  more than 328,348 unborn babies in 2016, and killed 6,803,782 unborn babies between 1978 and 2016,  according to CNS News .  (RELATED: Planned Parenthood At 101 Years: 7 Million Abortions And Counting) .
Richards was at the forefront of mobilizing pro-abortion forces and promoting Planned Parenthood’s services which include contraception, abortion pills, early abortions and dismemberment abortions where clinicians rip the babies apart limb by limb to kill them before pulling them out of the uterus.
Richard’s leadership has seen Planned Parenthood’s other services continues to decline. The abortion giant performed more than one million breast exams in 1999, but only 363,803 in 2014. Planned Parenthood offered only one adoption referral for every 114 abortions in 2016. Record numbers of abortions also followed after medication abortions became available in 2000, according to Planned Parenthood’s  100 Year Strong timeline .
Former Planned Parenthood, Manager Ramona Trevino, described the organization as “demonic” and told the DCNF that it grooms young girls as future abortion patients and promotes a promiscuous lifestyle. “We have monthly quotas to meet. They’re just numbers,” she said.  (RELATED: EXCLUSIVE: Ex-Planned Parenthood Employee Describes ‘Demonic’ Organization) .
The organization ran 938 clinics in 1995 when Planned Parenthood was at its peak operational level, according to an  American Life Leagues (ALL) Report , all of which were responsible for killing thousands upon thousands of unborn babies.
Her retirement follows the FBI’s  request for documents  from the Senate Judiciary Committee obtained from the committee’s investigation into Planned Parenthood’s fetal tissue dealings.
The investigation came after the Center for Medical Progress  published a series of explosive videos  in 2015 revealing the abortion giant was harvesting and distributing aborted baby parts for researchers. Senate Judiciary Chair Chuck Grassley referred Planned Parenthood to the FBI at the conclusion of that investigation, saying his committee found evidence indicating the group was profiting.  (RELATED: Report: FBI May Be Investigating Planned Parenthood Over Dealings In Aborted Fetuses) .
